text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Adventure Vision is a cartridge video game console incorporating a video monitor. Produced by Entex Industries and marketed from 1982, the Adventure Vision is the second console designed by Entex, it succeeds the Select-A-Game, a portable console released a year earlier in 1981. It has a processor at 733 KHz, 1 kB of RAM, graphics in 150x40 monochrome pixels and a sound chipset clocked at 52.6 kHz. This system has very few games.
